Key Match Events: The Sacramento Kings rallied from an 18-point deficit in the first quarter to win 110-100 against the Dallas Mavericks.
De'Aaron Fox finished the game with 33 points, six rebounds, six assists and one steal.
Domantas Sabonis tallied 17 points, 16 rebounds, seven assists and one steal.
P.J. Washington scored 19 points on 6-for-8 shooting, including 4-for-4 from deep, while Spencer Dinwiddie had 11 points in the first quarter.
The Kings flipped the script against the Mavericks in the third quarter, dominating their visitors 27-17.
Sacramento started the fourth quarter strong behind Fox and Trey Lyles. DeMar DeRozan scored a floater to make it 101-88 before the Kings held on for a 110-100 win.
Pre-Game Insights: Dallas entered the game without several key players, including Luka Doncic, Kyrie Irving, Klay Thompson and Dereck Lively II.
The Kings got a big boost from Domantas Sabonis, who tallied 17 points, 16 rebounds, seven assists and one steal.
Doug Christie, taking over the fired Mike Brown, won his first game as an interim head coach.
Post-Match Reflections: Doug Christie, the interim head coach of the Sacramento Kings, won his first game after taking over from Mike Brown.
The Kings bounced back from an 18-point deficit to win 110-100 against the Mavericks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks leaned on Spencer Dinwiddie and P.J. Washington without Luka Doncic, Kyrie Irving, Klay Thompson, and Dereck Lively II.
The Kings dominated the second half 54-40 after trailing 60-56 at halftime.
Trey Lyles got a big boost off the bench for the Kings in the third quarter.
Others: The Mavericks continued a four-game road trip with a matchup against the Sacramento Kings on Monday, their first of three meetings this season.
